table_items.text: STANDARD OPERATING PROCEDURE FOR THE TRANSFER OF CARDIAC INPATIENTS FROM BROOMFIELD HOSPITAL TO BASILDON HOSPITAL

data.text: Contents
The purpose of this Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) is to give guidance and direction for the transfer of cardiology inpatients from Broomfield Hospital to Basildon Hospital.

The service will deliver a seven day cardiology consultant service on James Mackenzie ward at Basildon Hospital, with Consultant of the Week (COW) cover 9am-5pm Mon-Fri and 9am- 12pm Sat-Sun. This is a collaborative partnership, inclusive of both Basildon and Mid Essex consultants.
The COW is supported by a Middle Grade of the Week (MOW) Mon-Fri 9am-5pm based on James Mackenzie ward.

Patients attending Mid Essex Emergency Department (ED) will have an assessment and initial treatment prior to a decision being made to transfer to Basildon. This will be initially provided by the acute medical services team and reviewed by the Broomfield Cardiology Liaison Service (led by Middle Grade and/or Specialist Nurse with Consultant oversight). Liaison between Broomfield and COW at Basildon will be facilitated by the use of the Forward App to share patient information and investigations such as blood test results and ECGs. Clinicians will also have access and training on the Acute Care Portal (ACP) for diagnostics and other patient information.

Patients will be transferred from Broomfield Hospital to Basildon Hospital in order to assist in resolving the bed deficit at Broomfield Hospital and support the maintenance of safe services over the winter period. Patients will have access to expert cardiology input across the MSE 24/7. This in turn will potentially increase medical bed capacity and elective activity in cardiac centre at Broomfield.

In the event James Mackenzie is at full bed capacity, the Basildon Cardiac Nurse Practitioner will update tele-tracking (and contact the hub on extension 2000), notify Broomfield site office on 01245 514 074 or x514666. NOTE: Broomfield site office will be required to discuss with the Broomfield Cardiac Nurse Practitioner, Cardiology Consultant/Registrar and AMU Nurse in Charge. Refer to Section 6, page 6 for more information.
Establish a process for bed management when James Mackenzie ward is at full capacity
Detail protocol for managing patient transfers
Standardised procedure for board rounds and telemedicine round
Adherence to established clinical pathways

The cardiology service will be available during core hours Monday to Friday and limited hours on the weekend. Telemed ward round will take place at specific points throughout the day to discuss any patients requiring transfer to Basildon. Whilst discussion around pathway positive patients will occur in the core hours, this does not restrict the times patients can be transferred to Basildon.
Consultant cover at Basildon

table_items.text: Ward round (James Mackenzie) & review inpatient referrals requested by cardiac CNS

data.text: The Cardiology Liaison Consultant will review patients each day on AMU with a view to cardiology transfer to Basildon. Patients should be transferred in date order, unless there is an urgent clinical need. All Consultant transfers will be accepted by Basildon, without the need for discussion with the COW.
Middle Grade referrals from Broomfield will require discussion with the COW, who can be contacted via the Basildon Hospital switchboard – 01268 524900.
At the point of an agreed transfer, patients will be recorded as under the COW at Basildon.

Patients that have been agreed for transfer will be accepted by James Mackenzie into the evening. Patients will only require a review by the overnight Medical Registrar at Basildon, if they have deteriorated on transfer.

data.text: At the weekend the above necessary requirements will be the responsibility of the AMU Doctor.
Board rounds will take place in AMU (at Broomfield) at 8:45am Monday to Friday. Expected attendance will be:
Cardiologist Consultant
Cardiology Middle Grade
Cardiac Nurse Practitioner
Cardiac Physiologist
Board rounds will take place on James Mackenzie (at Basildon) at 8:45am Monday to Friday. Expected attendance will be:
Cardiologist
Cardiology Middle Grade (Monday – Friday)
Cardiac Nurse Practitioner
Necessary information includes the cardiology referral document. The group will be required to adhere to the clinical pathways as stated in the appendices.
Telemed rounds will be carried out via spider phone at 1pm and 4pm Monday – Friday and will take place as follows:
Basildon: Ward Managers office, James Mackenzie ward OR in the treatment room
Broomfield: Meeting room Acute Medical Unit – Broomfield
Basildon Cardiac Nurse Practitioner (James Mackenzie) can be contacted via BTUH switchboard (01268 524900) on ext 7217, or bleep 6221
Broomfield Cardiac Liaison team can be contacted via 01245 51 2576
All staff will have access to Forward App and be given access to the specified group used to support cardiology. Forward App will be used to transfer images as required to the COW for review.
All staff will also be given training and access to the Acute Care Portal where they can access a range of IT systems including pathology and imaging across the MSE trusts.
James Mackenzie have 23 beds available. Beds will be prioritised for cardiology patients, and will only be used for medical outliers in the event that there are no cardiology patients to fill them.
MEHT Acute Medical Unit (AMU) has 44 beds with the capacity to monitor 20 beds.
MEHT Criteria for Cardiac monitoring is included in appendix 12.
Clinical priority, this will be decided within the clinical teams.

Update Teleltracking
Pathways have been identified for the following cardiac areas and can be found in the appendices 1-7:
Broomfield to review tele-tracking for current bed status
Patient will remain on Broomfield AMU under the care of the acute physicians and treatment plan constructed.
Patient will remain on Broomfield AMU until such time that a bed is available at Basildon
Nurse in Charge on James Mackenzie to contact the Tele-tracking Hub as soon as bed is available and contact Broomfield Nurse in Charge
Teletracking Hub to update Broomfield site office of bed availability, and advise Senior Manager On Call (SMOC) at both sites.

If Basildon is on internal incident James Mackenzie ward will be made available for cardiology patients as a priority, then medical patients will be considered. Approval for medical patients will be undertaken by the Director of Operations/Exec Oncall at BTUH.
Cardiac beds at Basildon to be ring fenced for Broomfield patients, a minimum of 4 beds allowing seamless transfer of pathway positive patients.
Patients waiting to be transferred to Basildon Hospital will be managed in date and time order, unless this is exacerbated by clinical priority.

Out of core working hour's emergency cases will be transferred by emergency ambulance. All other non-urgent cases will remain at Broomfield on the Acute Medical Unit until cardiology review the next day.
There are various methods of transport available to transfer patients to Basildon. These include:
East of England Ambulance;
Inter-hospital Treat and Transfer Ambulance (currently available 9-5pm weekends only);
Patient Transport Services (PTS): Thames Ambulance.
Criteria for the different types of patient transport is shown in Appendix 8 of this document.
i) Emergency/Urgent Patient Transfers
a) If patient is Emergency/Urgent, and the MSE Inter-hospital service (IHT) are not
available. Referring hospital to contact East of England (EOE) ambulance control via switchboard, or ring 999
b) In order to categorise your call EoE will ask for the following information:
Name of patient;
Weight of patient;
Diagnosis;
Where the patient is transferring to and from?
Referring doctors name;
Requesting hospital telephone number;
Are there any relatives travelling with the patient?
What is the patient's NEWS score?
Does the patient need a wheelchair or stretcher?
Does the patient require oxygen?
Is the patient currently on a defibrillator or will they need to have?
Can the patient be transferred with other patients?
c) The call operator will then agree with their superior the transfer category and provide the caller with a reference number.

d) If the MSE Interhospital Transfer service is available, the Teletracking Control Centre will arrange this mode of transport. The MSE Interhospital transfer is available 9-5pm Saturday/Sunday and Bank holidays, and is equipped to take patients with all acuity levels, staffed by a paramedic and an ODP.
ii) Non-urgent patient transfers

a) If the patients clinical condition has been stable for over 8 hours (NEWS ≤ 1) they would be deemed a non-urgent transfer (required in the next 2-3 hours) and would be transferred as per the retrieval process for CTC.
b) Thames ambulance patient transport can be requested online via the Healthcab system.
c) Telephone contact numbers for Thames PTS In hours: 01268 512005
Out of hours: 01163 666774
d) In order to request Patient Transport the following patient information will be required:
Name of Patient;
NHS Number;
Date of Birth;
Where is the patient travelling from and to?
Patient Mobility? i.e. stretcher/wheelchair;
Any equipment travelling with the patient;
Any special needs of the patient i.e. visually impaired;
Can the patient travel with other patients?
Patient journey date and time;
Requester of transfer.
The system then needs to be marked that the patient is ready to travel
iii) Patient Transport Survey (process)
a) As part of evaluating the service, a staff checklist form will be used capture details of the transfer. This will be used, along with the ambulance / transfer NEWS2 score recording sheet.
b) On discharge from James McKenzie Ward a patient survey will be completed alongside completion of the Friends and Family test.
c) Forms will be returned to the Strategy Unit in the Postgraduate Centre.
d) Examples of the checklist and survey are included as appendices 9 and 10.
DISCHARGE
16.5.1 Patients transferred from Broomfield Hospital will be discharged from Basildon Hospital and followed up at Broomfield Hospital in outpatients.

16.5.2 James Mackenzie ward will notify the Basildon Integrated Discharge Team (IDT) (as early as possible in the patient pathway), that the patient is anticipated to need IDT support on discharge. The Basildon IDT will make any necessary arrangements with the Broomfield IDT or with Essex County Council.
16.5.3 Basildon IDT team will make a daily visit to James Mackenzie ward to check for patients, as well as be contactable through extension 4512

16.5.4 Cardiology patients who are treated on James Mackenzie ward by a Broomfield Consultant (i.e. Dr Onkar Dhillon or Dr Duncan Coles), and are local to Basildon (not a transferred patient) will be followed up locally at Basildon Hospital by a Basildon Consultant.
Referral to MEHT OPA
If cardiologist named on the transfer document please ensure follow up is addressed to named consultant.
All referrals to go through MERC to this e mail address mie-tr.merc@nhs.net.
Please ensure appointment is clearly indicated as routine / urgent.

data.text: Cardiology Transfer Patient Questionnaire

We would really appreciate your feedback. If you would like to share your thoughts please complete the below questionnaire. All information collected in this questionnaire is anonymous and will be used to help improve patient experience.

table_items.text: Did the transfer team introduce themselves to you?
Did you understand the reason you were transferred?
If No, what was not explained?
Did you feel safe during transfer?
If Yes, what made you feel safe?
If Partly or No, what were your concerns?
Once you had arrived at the hospital you were transferred to, were you introduced to the team who were looking after you?

data.text: Yes No
Yes, Extremely Yes, Mostly Partly
No
Not relevant
I consent to this information being used to inform an evaluation for service improvement
